title: First Snow
excerpt: A rabbit has stopped on the gravel driveway: imbibing the silence, you stare at spruce needles...
body:
A rabbit has stopped on the gravel driveway:
imbibing the silence,
you stare at spruce needles:
there is no sound of a leaf blower.

The white blanket descends,
not with fury, but with a hush.
Every sharp edge of the world
is softened, rounded, forgiven.

Breath clouds in the air,
ephemeral ghosts of warmth,
while the trees stand patient,
wearing their new heavy coats.
